discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Preempt allows the router with it configured to take over the active role if it has a higher priority than the other router. So do you need it on both routers.
why not be answer is a?

comments.content:
maybe the timers doesn´t the same, but the hold timer it´s at least 3 times than the hello timer, for every Nexus, so the HSRP could be established.

I think the answer is B, or at least is the only logical for this options

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Preempt should only be used on the router with the highest priority. That way when it comes back up it can switch back to being the primary in the HSRP pair.

comments.content: The answer is B. Preempt has nothing to do with dual actives.

choices.C: Configure the IP address of N9K-B on the same subnet as N9K-A.
choices.D: Configure preempt on only one of the switches.
choices.A: Configure the HSRP timers to be the same.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. The HSRP instance on both switches is showing as active. Which action resolves the issue?

choices.D: Remove ip forward from interface Vlan30 and add it on interface Vlan100.
choices.C: Change the fabric forwarding anycast-gateway-mac MAC address.
choices.E: Enable HMM tracking to advertise host routes into the VXLAN fabric.
choices.A: Add fabric forwarding mode anycast-gateway on interface Vlan100.
choices.B: Configure correspondent IP addressing on every interface.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
Anycast MAC is wrong, compared to the one on the topology, plus the anycast mode has to be activated on the SVI100

choices.B: Create a route map that sets the IPv6 next hop.
choices.C: Configure an IPv6 BGP neighbor on R1.
choices.D: Advertise L2VPN EVPN under IPv4 unicast address family.

discussion.content:
Answer B would be a PBR. shouldn't be C ?
Anyway the exhibit shows ipv6 routes learned from R2 ? or i don't understand the question

Answer is A
“No Signal” on vKVM and Physical Video Connection
If immediately at boot you receive a “No Signal” message from the vKVM and physical video connection,
the PCI riser card might not be properly seated to the motherboard. To resolve the issue, complete these steps:
Procedure
Step 1 Power off the server and disconnect the power cord.
Step 2 Confirm that all cards are properly seated.
Step 3 Connect the power cord and power on the server.

choices.B:
1. Power off the server and disconnect the power cord.
2. Confirm that all cards are properly seated.
3. Connect the power cord and power on the server.
choices.C:
1. Disconnect the power cord.
2. Confirm that all cards are properly seated.
3. Connect the power cord.
choices.A:
1. Disconnect the power cord.
2. Confirm that all cards are properly seated.
3. Connect the power cord and power on the server.
choices.D:
1. Power off the server and disconnect the power cord.
2. Confirm that all cards are available.
3. Connect the power cord and power on the server.

questions.question_text: During a boot process of a Cisco UCS C-Series Rack Server, an engineer receives a “No Signal” message from the vKVM and physical video connection. Which set of steps resolves the issue?

discussion.content:
A. A Cisco APIC must be attached to a spine node only.
C. Spine nodes must connect to other spine nodes.
D. A Cisco APIC must be dual-attached to two separate spine nodes.

A → (discovery steps) APIC - LEAF - SPINE 
C → links between spines might not be supported.
D →APIC must be connect one or more leafs (its ok if the leaf is service leaf or border leaf)

choices.E: Leaf nodes must connect to spine nodes only.
choices.C: Spine nodes must connect to other spine nodes.
choices.B: A Cisco APIC must be attached to leaf nodes.
choices.D: A Cisco APIC must be dual-attached to two separate spine nodes.
choices.A: A Cisco APIC must be attached to a spine node only.

questions.question_text: An engineer troubleshoots a fabric discovery failure. Which two requirements about switch connectivity must be verified to solve the problem? (Choose two.)
